result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Payment of restitution= $396.21 + 10% surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent.
Payment of costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= $733.00- payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid Rx. No entry into any business whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Absolute sobriety.
AODA and follow through. Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Obtain and maintain full time employment. DNA Sample Due: 6-28-2022.

timeConds.notes: 45 days conditional jail, without good time, but with huber release. No credit for time served. Deft to report to the MCJ no later than 7PM on 6-28-22.

records.addlTxt:
2:27 PM Defendant Haley M. Malke in court.  Attorney robert James mraz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nathaniel A Johnson Esq in court for Haley M. Malke. 
Court calls case.
ADA heard.
Atty Johnson provides a plea form.
ADA provides a copy of the DJA.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Johnson agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court informs of Firearm and voting restrictions if found guilty to Count 1.
Victim rights compliance.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Atty Johnson satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court accepts the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea but withholds the finding of guilt on Count 1, subject to the terms of the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 2.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Johnson heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and Stayed on Count 2:
9 months jail, and places deft on probation for 1 year.
Conditions of probation:
45 days conditional jail, without good time, but with huber release.
No credit for time served.
Deft to report to the Marinette County Jail no later than 7pm on 06-28-2022.
Payment of restitution = $396.21 + 10% surcharge - payment to be worked out with agent.
Payment of costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $733.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
Absolute sobriety.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription.
AODA and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment. 
No entry into any business whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
DNA sample due 06-28-2022.
Appeal rights.

Copy of complaint.

Deft understands.
